summary:
The Security Council, 
Welcoming the report of the Secretary-General on the United Nations operation in Cyprus, 
Noting the need to keep the UN Peacekeeping force in Cyprus (UNFICYP) beyond 15 December 2008, 
Echoing the Secretary-General’s belief that the Cypriots themselves are responsible for finding a solution, 
Welcoming the launch of negotiations on 3 September 2008 and progress made, 
Emphasizing the importance of full, flexible and constructive engagement in negotiations, 
Encouraging momentum in negotiations and maintenance of goodwill and trust, 
Welcoming confidence-building measures and cancellation of military exercises, 
Reaffirming the importance of continued Green Line crossings, 
Convinced of the benefits of a comprehensive Cyprus settlement, 
Highlighting the supportive role of the international community, 
Taking note of the stable security situation, 
Recalling the Secretary-General’s belief on the buffer zone situation, 
Welcoming demining progress and concern on funding, 
Welcoming Committee on Missing Persons progress, 
Agreeing on the importance of an active civil society, 
Reaffirming the Secretary-General’s review of UNFICYP operations, 
Welcoming the appointment of Alexander Downer as Special Advisor, 
Echoing gratitude to contributors to UNFICYP funding and requesting further contributions.
Here is a summarized version of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

1. Welcomes the Secretary-General's report on developments in Cyprus over the last six months.

2. Welcomes the launch of negotiations on 3 September 2008 and the prospect of a comprehensive settlement.

3. Urges full exploitation of this opportunity, including intensifying negotiations and preserving trust and goodwill.

4. Welcomes confidence-building measures and looks forward to their implementation and further steps.

5. Reaffirms all relevant resolutions on Cyprus, particularly resolution 1251 (1999).

6. Extends the mandate of UNFICYP until 15 June 2009 and expresses full support for the mission.

7. Calls on both sides to engage in consultations with UNFICYP on buffer zone demarcation and the 1989 aide-memoire.

8. Calls on the Turkish Cypriot side and Turkish forces to restore the military status quo in Strovilia.

9. Requests a report on implementation by 1 June 2009 and regular updates from the Secretary-General.

10. Welcomes efforts to implement the zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation and abuse and requests continued action.
